task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder. GUI instructions: To load all MF4 files: Go to File → Open, then enter the path of the desired folder, select any .MF4 file, press Ctrl + A to highlight all files in the folder, and then press Enter to load them all.

plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application so subsequent GUI actions target the correct window
Discover current UI elements (menus, buttons) before interacting
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (prerequisite for concatenation)
Capture menu items shown after opening Mode so Batch processing option can be selected
Select 'Batch processing' mode (required for concatenate operation)
Refresh UI state now that app is in Batch processing mode
Open the File menu to use the Open command to load files from the target folder
Discover File → Open menu item in order to open the file dialog
Invoke the Open command to show the file selection dialog
Capture the file dialog UI elements (File name edit, file list) before entering the folder path
Enter the target folder path into the file dialog's File name field and press Enter to navigate to that folder
Refresh file dialog state now showing files in the target folder so a specific .MF4 file can be selected
Select any single .MF4 file in the folder as the initial selection (required before Ctrl+A to select all)
Press Ctrl+A in the file dialog to select all .MF4 files in the folder (per user's GUI instructions)
Confirm the selection and load all selected files into asammdf
Capture the Batch processing view after files are loaded so batch operations (Concatenate) can be selected
If present, ensure loaded files appear in the batch list by using 'Add files' (some batch views require this step); safe no-op if files are already listed
Refresh UI state to reveal batch operation controls (operation selection, options, output filename field)
Select the 'Concatenate' batch operation to combine the loaded files into a single continuous measurement
Capture any operation-specific options (e.g., sync using measurement timestamps) before configuring them
Toggle the 'Sync using measurement timestamps' option as needed (click to set or leave in default state). Use this if synchronization is required for correct concatenation
Refresh UI to ensure the output filename field is available and ready for input
Enter the full output file path and filename into the output File name field so the concatenated MF4 is saved to the same folder with the requested name
Confirm the Save/Start control is present and enabled before starting the concatenation
Start the concatenate operation and save the resulting MF4 file to the specified path
Optionally verify that the new file appears in the application or that a success message is shown

Switch to Batch processing mode (required for concatenate), open the folder containing all .MF4 files, select all files using Ctrl+A (per user's instructions), choose the Concatenate batch operation, set synchronization option if needed, provide the full output path and filename in the same folder, and save. Repeated State-Tool calls ensure current UI elements are discovered before each interaction.
